thanks for all the love people, glad you enjoyed! this was a short peek into the big things we could be doing at the Network School: 

For context we had about 40 people show up to our 'Decoding the Brain' workshop: https://lu.ma/iyg4osox where @undefined presented about BCIs, and i ran an experiment where we collected EEG responses to different stimulus. at least 10 people showed interest in signing up to be participants in research which we could conduct in the future here at NS.

All the EEG responses were recorded using https://causality.network (a platform we're building to authenticate scientific data - 70% of all scientific data produced, isn't reproducible due to issues with data integrity). the datasets generated were hashed and the metadata, has been attested on-chain - you can see them here: (https://base.easscan.org/schema/view/0xbecbf8b1bd8992cbd43db64be07a2cd64a47fadab545ad2e77859f9e753bb5fb).

I envision NS to be an important node in DeSci (decentralised science) where we're able to setup more controlled research/experiment environments (or an actual lab), get more capable EEG devices like the https://www.neuroconcise.co.uk/ (costs about $3k per device, probably the least expensive 'research grade' EEG device), and run valuable experiments around cognitive health and neuroscience. (in future expand to other important research areas, have a tokenomic structure to incentivise participants, let labs, scientists build on our datasets, etc.)

would love to have your thoughts @undefined on how we can proceed in making this happen - i will also book an office hours session shortly to discuss at length how i can contribute to this vision.

This can be a delicate topic, but still think it's worth mentioning:

Maintaining a Body Mass Index (which is related to your weight) between 18.5 - 25 is associated with a lower risk of heart disease and diabetes. So, paying attention to your weight may be of interest if you want to remain disease-free for longer. And it may be better to be in the middle-lower end of that spectrum than bordering on either side of it. You can use ChatGPT/Perplexity to get a BMI estimate.

An important qualifier: for many people, paying too much attention to weight can lead to serious psychological issues. You'll need to be honest with yourself to evaluate the trade-offs and decide whether or not you're in a place to pay attention to your weight healthfully.

Also, some people take issue with BMI as a metric broadly (it's a single metric, originally developed using a reference class of white men, etc). But to be honest I think the basic point - your weight is a relevant variable in health outcomes - still stands broadly.

The book "Eat, Drink, and Be Healthy" is my reference here. If others have better sources I would love to read them!

On the one hand, people in the NS starting relationships with each other can make the community stronger, and in the long term grow the NS. It's also a basic human need, and if it isn't getting met, people might leave. On the other hand, it adds more potential for drama (breakups, jealousy) that might cause people to leave the NS. 

That said, I'd suggest some kind of singles club, for us lonely hearts to find each other. Maybe someone will get techy with it and invent a better Tinder.

@undefined üëÄ  Looked at the world‚Äôs GDP trajectory in 3D instead of 2D like the one you showed.
You were right, the west-to-east shift remains true when looking at it in 3D too.
But there‚Äôs even more colour in addition to that: there is a trend since one century towards the centre of earth, meaning the GDP is more distributed across opposite points of the globe, and while it seems like it's moving faster on the surface, it's actually moving less, but deeper.
So here are my 2 cents of the day: through history, there were places where capital and talent (=GDP) converged, like London, New York, then San Francisco in most recent history, which actually managed to pull the economic barycentre of the world close to the surface. hi all, it seems that there are many in here who are looking for cofounders, collaborators, partnerships, etc.¬†food for thought: i imagine there will be plenty of organic networking, but i propose for the more reserved/busy amongst us perhaps (as a potential additional session(s) to @undefined's start-up school?) some kind of founder speed-dating event(s).

**a few ideas for structuring this but not married to any of these:**

(1) pitch + match/unblocking sessions/lightning rounds -¬†founders present a brief problem/solution/pitch (note: this should be a grift-free zone so only do this if your intent is genuine feedback/community unblocking) their project/idea, followed by quick feedback or expressions of interest from others. open floor for people to raise their hands if they have complementary skills to help tackle the problem and unblock their peers. it always amazes me how i can spend ages on a problem and once i mention it to friends, they unblock within moments.

(2) industry-specific rooms: we could break out into rooms based on specific sectors so people can connect with others working in similar spaces?

(3) partnership brainstorming:¬†ns members could list their skills, needs, and areas of expertise, and we facilitate matching people up for 10-minute brainstorming sessions around collaboration ideas.

(4) follow-up networking: after the event, we could have a shared doc or discord channel where people can list their wants/blocks/areas of expertise & follow up with the connections they made, so no one falls through the cracks.

This is just me planting a seed and I'll keep¬†noodling on this.¬† I'd love to help organize but I am more of a zealous small business owner than a founder and I think someone else in here may be more suitable and enthusiastic to execute and iterate üôÇ

Producing an MVP for the "AI Conference Organizer" bounty could also be quite accessible.

The skill to craft here is figuring out how to simplify the product requirements to get you to an MVP. As a hint: perhaps try figuring out how you can build a product that takes in a single PDF (with a slide on each page) and validate if it matches the required constraints.

You can use AI tools to get unstuck, to figure out the simplest way to start, and once you've reached a milestone and are trying to figure out how to reach a next milestone it can help you plan out the next steps. And, ofc, can also ask for help in Discord.

I would say the Cloud Cartography bounty can be scaled up/down to different levels on difficulty. There has been some discussion here <#1282669934970802268>.

The "easier" version is to use an existing API (something like Warpcast API or Dune Analytics) to get all the data you need and then just focus on building the visualizations.

The "harder" version involves writing code that downloads all the data from the Farcaster network yourself, and then making that data available to an app that creates the visualizations. Will avoid going into details here, but this is a significant amount more work than making an API call to something like the Warpcast API. The upside is that your end application will be able to render the visualizations much more quickly.

Network Smoothie and Juice Pop-up Shop Overview

Objective:
Create and crowd fund a pop-up Network Smoothie Shop on the 13th Floor of the Marina Hotel for 2 hours each afternoon. 

Offer healthy, delicious, cold, blended smoothies and cold-pressed juices with natural ingredients in reusable cups.

Crowdfund $1000 through a Genesis Goodness Group by using pre-sales of smoothies at a discount.   

Leverage this experiment both as a service to the community and a small, replicable, working model for future crowdfunding initiatives to stand up new ideas in the community (ice bath/cold plunge, etc next?)

Funding:
Community Funding: $1,000
Upfront Expenses:
Blender:: $250
High(ish) quality both for durability and functionality to smoothly blend in fibrous veggies and frozen fruits, making them smooth to the taste.  Thus making them smoothies.  See what I did there? ;-))
Juice: On loan from Sharon and Teri, but could also be purchased second hand or rented:$150?
Cups and lids: $200 
(will source reusable, and ideally branded cups to reduce waste)
Fruits, seeds & vegetables: $200
Juices and nut milks: $150
Signage (menu, payment methods) & Misc: $50
Total Upfront Expenses:  $1000 

Projected Revenue:
Cost per drink: $4-5++ (dep on add ons like: avocado, protein,etc...) 
Number of drinks sold per day: 20 - 40 
Monthly revenue:: assume 22/day so about 650/mo at an average price of $4.5 so about $3k/mo in top line revs as an average assuming weekends, if open, will be lighter with people away
Profit - Assume ~$1/drink so 6 weeks to break even

Crowd Funding / Genesis Goodness Group
Sell drink credits at a discount to raise the $1k needed to get this launched 
$50 - 15 smoothies 
$100 - 40 smoothies
Raise $1,000 across 10-20 people for equipment, ingredients, cups, etc
Charge everyone else $4 - $5++ per smoothie, depending on ingredients
Can use profits to upgrade equipment/ingredients and/or hire someone to man the station
Any extra money can be donated or put on an event

Svetlana thought it would be quite a manual process to use Photoshop to create filters that blend photos with the background photos we created with Midjourney. She thought each photo would need to be touched up individually with that approach, and that one template wouldn't work across individual photos. She encouraged trying to find an AI tool that would just automatically do some consistent sylization

*Context: The prototype I shared contains an AI-generated photo of Carla (via PhotoAI). The benefit of trying to use something like this is we can ensure a standardized style, posture, etc. across the photos.

# Day 5 Quest: Harnessing AI for Code Writing with Aider

## Objective
Learn to use Aider, a state-of-the-art command-line tool that writes code for you, and enhance your AI development workflow.

## Tasks
1. Set up Aider:
   - Read the Aider quick start guide
   - Set up Aider with your OpenAI API key on Replit
   - Familiarize yourself with basic Aider commands

2. Enhance your Quest 1 script:
   - Use Aider to modify and improve the script you created in Quest 1
   - Document the changes and improvements made with Aider's assistance

3. Bonus Challenge 1: Aider with Claude:
   - Obtain an Anthropic Claude API key
   - Set up Aider to use Claude 3.5 Sonnet
   - Compare the coding results between OpenAI and Claude models

4. Bonus Challenge 2: Dive into Aider's development:
   - Read articles on the Aider blog about testing strategies
   - Learn how the Aider team determines which models and prompts work best
   - Reflect on how this knowledge could improve your own AI development practices

## Why This Matters
- Experience cutting-edge AI-assisted coding tools
- Improve your existing code with AI assistance
- Understand the differences between various AI models for coding tasks
- Gain insights into AI tool development and testing strategies

## Tips
- Take time to understand Aider's capabilities and limitations
- Experiment with different prompts and coding tasks in Aider
- When using Claude, pay attention to its strengths in coding tasks
- Consider how Aider's development insights could apply to your own projects

# Day 4 Quest: Using OpenAI Code Interpreter for Data Analysis

Here is a csv of data about all the major cities in the world, pulled from nomadlist in 2021.

Today we will be using the Data Analyst GPT to code for us and parse through this csv.

Go to https://chatgpt.com/g/g-HMNcP6w7d-data-analyst to load the data analyst GPT. This is a chatgpt version with a "code interpreter", which lets the LLM run python code on it's side, to run various functions. The LLM thinks about what to do, makes code, runs the code, examines the results, and then decides whether it is done or if it needs to fix its own code and try again.

From the Data Analyst GPT, upload the csv file. Your first prompt is:

"Load this csv into a pandas df and examine the head. Then print out all column headers."

This is a good first step into giving the LLM insight into what kind of data is in the csv.

Next you will work with the AI to determine what city is best for you. 2nd prompt is:

"Ask me 5 questions in one message about my preferences for cities. I will respond to all messages. Then you will use this information to create a scoring system to score the cities in the dataset by these criteria. Finally you will run the scoring system on the dataset to determine what the top cities are for me. You will output a csv with the top 20 cities for me by this scoring system."

This should give you some output csv. You probably want to Work with the AI to improve the scoring system, because it's first draft of the scoring system might be a bit off. When done, tell the discord chat what your top 3 cities, and maybe a comment about the kind of things you prioritized.

Bonus for those who want more coding: At the end, ask the AI to output the code it used, then run the code locally on your own side or in a replit.

Tips: You may want to work with the AI on it's scoring system to normalize the data.

**Project Plan Summary for AI Chatbot System**

**1. Project Overview**
- **Project Name**: AI Chatbot System for School Network Attendees  
- **Objective**: Develop an AI chatbot to assist students with inquiries about laundry services, dining options, groceries, and transportation.  
- **Target Audience**: School students.

**2. Scope of Work**
- **Core Features**:  
   - Chatbot interface for user interaction.  
   - Factual responses to FAQs (laundry, dining, groceries, transportation).  
   - Schedule integration with personal calendars.  
   - Highlight student discounts.  
   - Offline access to key information.  
   - Community bulletin board.

**3. Project Phases**
- **Planning (Weeks 1-2)**: Define requirements, gather service information, select technology stack, and create data structures.  
- **Design (Weeks 3-4)**: Design chatbot interface, conversation flows, and database structure.  
- **Development (Weeks 5-8)**: Build the chatbot, integrate AI, implement updates, and add multilingual and voice interaction features.  
- **Testing (Weeks 9-10)**: Unit, integration, and usability testing with student feedback.  
- **Deployment (Week 11)**: Deploy the chatbot and monitor performance.  
- **Maintenance (Ongoing)**: Continuous updates based on feedback and adding new features.

**4. Resources Required**
- **Personnel**: Project Manager, UI/UX Designer, Frontend/Backend Developers, AI Specialist.  
- **Tools**: Chatbot Framework (e.g., Dialogflow), Programming Languages (e.g., Python), Database (e.g., MongoDB), Hosting (e.g., AWS).

**5. Budget Estimate**
- Personnel costs, technology licenses, hosting, and miscellaneous expenses.

**6. Key Milestones**
- Completion of each phase, from planning to deployment.
